main event: A civilian in Hiram, Georgia, observed a round object with a bright yellow-white glow traveling soundlessly from south to north until it disappeared into a white cloud on 6-13-53.
interesting points: The object was similar in size and shape to a hub cap with a bright or luminous yellow-white area.
The object traveled at a very slow speed in a straight flight bearing slightly downward and disappeared behind a cloud.
The report includes specific winds aloft data at different altitudes during the sighting.
The report was inconclusive due to insufficient data for evaluation.
The object appeared to be too close to be a satellite and was not astronomical in nature.
sighted object: a round object with a bright yellow-white glow
